TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit XData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents literal data that can appear as the value for a node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData.Text%2A> is the XAML content property for <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData>. To read values from out of a XAML node stream where `XData` is returned, get the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData.Text%2A> property value.
Encoding considerations are declared at top-level XML, and are generally UTF-8 by default.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Text { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Text : string with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the literal value string that this wraps.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData.Text%2A> is the XAML content property for <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData>. To read values from out of a XAML node stream where `XData` is returned, get the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData.Text%2A> property value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ XmlReader { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };
member this.XmlReader : obj with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a reader for the literal data.
Docs.value: A reader for the literal data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If no reader is previously set for `XData`, calling the get accessor creates a new <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> for this purpose.
The type of this property is <xref:System.Object> rather than <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> in order to provide an optimization pathway for callers that do not want to include the `System.Xml` assembly just for the base type definitions, and who will be using the default reader.
